result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael B. Karrasch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael B. Karrasch

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael B. Karrasch in court with attorney John H. Bradley.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions def and reviews chgs and pens.  Guilty plea entered in count 1 of the criminal complaint;  court accepts plea and finds def guilty.  Atty Tienstra heard on sentencing recomendations.  Atty Bradley responds.  Def makes stmt.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

w/held sentence
18 mos probation
AODA
Court Costs
No violent or abusive contact w/anyone
Counseling as directed by agent
Stay out of bars
Maintain absolute sobriety
Jury trial on June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

11:07 am. Defendant Michael B. Karrasch in court with attorney John H. Bradley.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Bradley heard, stipulation has not been reached requests scheduling for return date an trial.  Jury trial scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Atty. Bradley will call for Return date/plea and sentencing if stipulation reached.
In-Person Status Conference on May 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Michael B. Karrasch in court with attorney John H. Bradley.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Karrasch heard - continued discussions, but wants JT taken off and IPSTC set, either plea or new JT date; IPSTC set; JT removed; bond cont.
Return date on March 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
to extend time to file pretrial motions
(previously posted)   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

9:33 - Defendant, Michael B. Karrasch in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court sets $150 cash (as previously posted) bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Return date scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
